People are very apt to believe what they wish to believe. Marx was no exception to the rule.

But, further, two celebrated economists, the two ¹sor whom Marx had most respect, Adam Smith and David Ricardo, had in some measure fallen into the same error. Ricardo, for instance, had gone so far asto write thus: “Gold and silver, like all other commodities, are valuable only in pro- portion to the quantity of labour necessary to produce them, and bring them to market.
